pullRequest.body:
And remove one commented counter: there is now a lint against deprecations without a date, so keeping it is probably not useful.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [1fe8da9f0a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15490/commits/1fe8da9f0a00e1c3daf6e415472d7e54843ef14b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by adomani.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10260656524/job/28387083573)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10260656524/job/28387083942)

```suggestion
print '%s|%s\n' "$(git grep "^open .*Classical" | grep -v " in$" -c)" "bare open (scoped) Classical"
```
Besides merging two greps into one, I also added a check that `open` starts the line: the non-starters looked like false positives.

I think that the reports of the script have motivated people to take action to reduce some of the debts.  So, while I agree that the linter tracks un-dated `deprecation`s, it might still be useful to include it in the reports.  Maybe adding a comment to the extent that this is tracked by a linter.

Indeed; this is one reason I'm proposing to track bare "open Classical" statements :-)

I just checked: that linter is never allowed; the current 11 hits are all false positives. Do we ever expect the linter to be allowed? I don't, so I'm not sure if including this actually helps anybody. (Reporting a line that is always zero, if we don't expect that to change, does not seem helpful to me.)
I can certainly add a comment that some previous technical debt, which is now fixed and (if applicable) linted against, is not tracked any more.
No, you convinced me: I'm happy to remove this counter.

```suggestion
printf '%s|%s\n' "$(git grep "^open .*Classical" | grep -v " in$" -c)" "bare open (scoped) Classical"
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: include bare 'open Classical' in tech debt metrics
